article_title: State departments prepare for ACA impact
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox.

article_metadata.description: CONCORD – State departments will not allow most of their seasonal employees to work full time this year in an effort to bring the state in compliance with the Affordable Care Act.The decision comes as federal law shifts this year to require 95 percent of each employer’s full-time workers to receive health insurance. Last year, only 70 percent of full-time employees needed to be insured under the law, also known as “Obamacare.”Seasonal employees are used in various
article_metadata.author: Max Sullivan
